other_tests.findings: Conjunctival goblet cells were identified on the corneal surface, confirming conjunctivalization.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The impression cytology diagnosis remained consistent as the disease progressed.

other_tests.findings: Notable superficial vascularization of peripheral cornea, loss of limbal palisades of Vogt, and irregular hazy epithelium.
other_tests.changes_over_time: During a mean follow-up of 6.1 years, vascularization advanced in four patients and remained stable in three.

other_tests.findings: Positive late fluorescein staining in the vascularized corneal region of all patients.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The conjunctivalization and related staining patterns were consistent with disease progression.

other_tests.findings: Normal sensitivity detected in the cornea, lid margins, and conjunctiva.
